content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron gear wheel production line at position around (16.0, 71.0) to (21.5, 73.5)
Consists of the following connected entities forming a production chain for iron gear wheels:
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) extracting iron ore
- Stone furnace at position (17.0, 73.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates
- Burner inserter at position (17.5, 71.5) moving iron ore from the mining drill to the furnace
- Burner inserter at position (23.5, 73.5) feeding iron plates into the assembling machine
- Burner inserter at position (19.5, 73.5) taking iron gear wheels from the assembling machine
- Wooden chest at position (18.5, 73.5) collecting iron gear wheels
- Assembling machine 2 at position (21.5, 73.5) set to craft iron gear wheels from iron plates
- Small electric pole at position (21.5, 75.5) providing electricity connections to the assembling machine and inserters

This structure integrates mining, smelting, assembling, and storage within a compact area, connected by inserters and powered by an electric pole.

ERROR TIPS

### Errors related to fuel insertion and fuel shortages
- Multiple attempts to insert coal into burner mining drills, furnaces, and burner inserters failed due to "No coal to insert from your inventory."
- Ensure sufficient coal is harvested and present in the player inventory before attempting to fuel burner entities.
- Avoid attempting to insert fuel when inventory is empty; add checks to confirm inventory contents before insertion.
- Fuel shortages cause burner mining drills, furnaces, and burner inserters to stop working, halting production.

### Errors related to assembler not receiving power despite connections
- Assembling machine 2 remains without power even after connecting to electric poles.
- Verify that electric poles are correctly placed and connected within the power network.
- Check that poles cover the assembling machine and all inserters requiring electricity.
- Confirm that poles themselves have power and that the power network is energized.

### Errors inserting items into inserters repeatedly without inventory items
- Repeated exceptions when inserting coal into burner inserters indicate attempts to insert items not present in inventory.
- Implement inventory checks before insertion calls to prevent exceptions.
- Avoid redundant insertion attempts when inserters are already fueled or when inventory is empty.

### General placement and connection tips (from previous report)
- Confirm target tiles are free before placing entities to avoid collisions.
- Use inserters to extract items from furnaces before feeding belts; direct belt connections from furnaces are invalid.
- Ensure correct assembling machine type is available in inventory before placement.
- Regularly verify power network connectivity and energy levels of electric entities.

NAMESPACE

No user-defined functions have been defined in the current steps.
